content: XXXhttp://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=102205776XXX The former Marxist rebels, who fought a guerilla war from 1980-1992, are the first leftist party to come to power in the country's history. Though the party is a coalition of left-wing groups, it's dominated by the Communist Party.
reply: XXXhttp://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=102205776XXX The former Marxist rebels, who fought a guerilla war from 1980-1992, are the first leftist party to come to power in the country's history. title: Communists win in El Salvador

content: Dominated by the communist party? How so? How many seats did the Communist party win?

title: Communists win in El Salvador

content: quote: Originally posted by LineDoggie: XXXhttp://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=102205776XXX The former Marxist rebels, who fought a guerilla war from 1980-1992, are the first leftist party to come to power in the country's history. Though the party is a coalition of left-wing groups, it's dominated by the Communist Party. Good for them. They abandoned violent revolution for the promise of free elections. Now they won one. The Sandinistas have also been Democratically elected - Twice. They lost an election and bowed to the will of the majority. You have a problem with that? If you note from your link, the Communists were just one group in a coalition. As long as they respect Democracy - I don't have a problem. If they become a dictatorship, that's another matter. Dave
